reporting_cycle: The Panel of Experts shall provide a midterm report by 4 August 2023 and a final report by 2 February 2024, and submit them to the Council by 8 September 2023 and 8 March 2024 respectively.
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous relevant resolutions and statements, 

Determines that proliferation of nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons continues to constitute a threat to international peace and security.

Acting under Article 41 of Chapter VII of the Charter:

1. Extends until 30 April 2024 the mandate of the Panel of Experts, as specified in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 (2009) and modified in subsequent resolutions, and requests the Secretary-General to take necessary administrative measures.

2. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 4 August 2023 and to the Council by 8 September 2023, and a final report to the Committee by 2 February 2024 and to the Council by 8 March 2024.

3. Requests the Panel to provide a planned programme of work to the Committee within thirty days, and encourages regular discussions between the Committee and the Panel.

4. Underscores the importance of credible, fact-based, independent assessments, analysis, and recommendations by the Panel.

5. Expresses its intent to continue following the work of the Panel.

6. Urges all States, UN bodies, and interested parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Panel.

7. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
